related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* High CPU usage with LTM (Long Term Memory) engine in PiecesOS
* Discord and Microsoft Edge affected most
* Problem persists across different hardware and Windows versions

**Problems identified:**

* Performance issues with LTM engine causing high CPU usage
* Reduced responsiveness in Discord and Microsoft Edge

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Hotfix released for PiecesOS
* Patch for 11.2.2 to improve CPU usage
* Further investigation into WebView interactions with LTM

**Current status/outcome:**

* Improved performance with LTM engine compared to earlier versions
* Some CPU spikes still observed with heavy browser usage
* Continued investigation and optimization underway

**Additional observations:**

* Issue seems related to interaction between LTM and WebView in Edge
* Limiting browser tabs reduces impact on CPU usage
* User reports improvement with fewer tabs and LTM enabled

**Overall:**

The issue of high CPU usage with LTM has been partially addressed with released patches. Further investigation and optimization are ongoing to fully resolve the problem and improve overall performance.

* LTM potentially unable to access code inside a sandboxed browser environment.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue remains open as of the latest conversation on March 3rd, 2025.
* User is advised to wait for the 11.2.0 PiecesOS release and contact Mark-at-pieces if the issue persists.
* No further updates or solutions are available in the provided conversation.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## GitHub Issue Summary: High CPU and RAM Usage in PiecesOS

### Key Points Raised:

* Many users are experiencing high RAM and CPU usage with PiecesOS, even when not actively using it.
* Some users report usage exceeding 5GB of RAM and 100% CPU.
* This issue has been ongoing since at least April 2024 and persists despite updates.

### Problems Identified:

* High resource usage makes PiecesOS impractical for some users.
* This could be due to memory leaks or other inefficiencies.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Pieces developers are working on improving resource usage.
* Version 11.1.0 replaced heavy database technologies, which may improve the situation.
* An "Optimize Memory" option is available to unload unused ML models.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* Some users report improvements with version 11.1.0.
* Others still experience high CPU and RAM usage, even with LTM-2 update.
* Developers are actively investigating the issue.

### Additional Notes:

* Users have suggested a "lite" mode with fewer features and lower resource usage.
* Some users have found workarounds like setting process affinity to E-cores.
* This issue remains open and under investigation.

Pieces developers are actively investigating and optimizing LTM to resolve these issues.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User (@MoyinShabi) reported an issue with connecting Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* The issue arose after a major update was pushed to the platform.
* User didn't receive any notifications about potential health checks or data migration.

**Problems Identified:**

* An issue with the user's desktop app's database was discovered.
* The exact cause of the inability to boot the app wasn't identified but could be related to the user's setup.
* An error message suggested that the GetIt package in Flutter was missing a registered dependency.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team requested log files and the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* A solution to a potentially related issue was implemented with a repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user confirmed that the issue persists despite replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* The root cause of the issue remains unidentified but is suspected to be related to a missing dependency in the GetIt package.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user mentioned a potential network issue during file upload.
* The issue was being actively investigated by the Pieces team at the time of the conversation.

## Overall, the issue remains unresolved, but the Pieces team is actively working towards a solution.

* The exact cause of the inability to boot the app wasn't identified but could be related to the user's setup.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
